text: Craven Arms is a small market town and civil parish in the county of Shropshire, England. It is located south of the county town of Shrewsbury and north of Ludlow. The population of the town in the 2011 census was 2,289. It is a relatively new town (compared to other places in Shropshire), being only a small village called Newton on a 1695 map. It is located in the Shropshire Hills Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty and is the site of the Shropshire Hills Discovery Centre. The River Onny flows to the town's east. The town has a railway station that provides direct trains to Shrewsbury, Manchester, North Wales and South Wales. The Heart of Wales railway line joins the Welsh Marches line just outside the town's station. ==Gallery== File:Craven_Arms_2011.JPG|Craven Arms viewed from the east File:Craven_Arms_- _geograph.org.uk_-_522660.jpg|Looking down Corvedale Road File:19.10.10 Craven Arms 175.004 (6029464565).jpg|A train at Craven Arms station Category:Market towns in England Category:Towns in Shropshire Category:Civil parishes in Shropshire
title: Craven Arms
